Lack of definitive data: The expert mentions that they were unable to find a single, definitive source of data to determine the percentage of applicants who pass or fail the military entrance exam. This lack of reliable data makes it difficult to verify the authenticity of the claim.
Military entrance exam: The expert mentions that applicants for the military take the Armed Services Vocational Aptitude Battery (ASVAB) which includes the Armed Forces Qualification Test (AFQT). The AFQT measures applicants' verbal and math abilities, among other areas. This aspect of the claim can be verified by examining the content and scoring system of the military entrance exam.
Disqualifying factors: The expert states that health, including problems like obesity, is the largest single disqualifying factor for military applicants. This information can be verified by looking at the official guidelines and requirements set by the military regarding health and physical fitness.
Statement from Jeb Bush: s spokeswoman: The expert mentions that Jeb Bush's spokeswoman clarified his statement and said that he meant to say that about one-third of applicants fail the military entrance exam. This aspect of the claim can be verified by examining the official statements or speeches made by Jeb Bush regarding the pass/fail rates of the military entrance exam.
